content:
Did something recently change with "·" as used to descend into cases in tactic mode? (e.g. here https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/9e5051487093c19f683d3f7d1fff6ced0847b39d/Mathlib/Logic/Function/Basic.lean#L599-L603)

In emacs, I used to be able to type \cdot to enter that, but as of today it seems that \cdot yields "⬝", which is apparently the wrong centered dot.
ah. Yes, that seems to give me the correct one
but I'm still confused about what changed to make \cdot no longer work for me.

I believe this changed in December when we started using the vscode abbreviation list in the emacs mode as well: https://github.com/leanprover/lean4-mode/commit/89d6bfa4b6fafe6360c13135eed0bc72526e8e04
